docs.text: synopsis : a man whose lover , paris , was murdered agrees to test out an experimental virtual reality home unit system .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the subject escapes from the real world and his current girlfriend , laura , and becomes addicted to virtual reality , which , due to a design flaw in his unit , recreates the dead paris .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: comments : virtual seduction , executive produced by roger corman and lance h . robbins , serves as a cheaply-made precursor to strange days , a far superior film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: both movies deal with desperate men who have trouble relating to their current lovers because they are ( ab ) using technology to be with former lovers ( in strange days , the technology utilized recorded dreams rather than virtual reality ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: interestingly , both films also take place a couple of years from now during the turn of the new millenium , though strange days uses the setting far more effectively .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this exemplifies the problem with virtual seduction .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's not bad for what it is : low-budget science fiction concerning the psychological dangers of virtual reality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , it's been done before and since in much better films , a fact which ultimately leaves the sci-fi fan bored by this movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: virtual seduction has many faults ( one of them is the fact that the video inexplicably has its own trailer before it begins ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film's script explores the possibilities of virtual reality interestingly at first , but its treatment of the subject matter gets heavy-handed and wooden as the movie progresses .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: many important scenes seem too dark ; the lighting could have been improved significantly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the cast , a collection of veteran b-movie actors and sitcom regulars , do only a mediocre job in their roles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jeff fahey , of the original lawnmower man , convincingly , though unenergetically , plays the lead character .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: carrie genzel plays paris , the vr lover , but ami dolenz , as the current love interest , seems like a much more interesting and attractive character with a caring personality , which doesn't lend credence to the film's premise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: meschach taylor , of the once popular designing women sitcom , adequately plays a scientist working on the project , but his performance isn't something to write home about either .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: virtual seduction is one of those harmless movies to which you could do some light manual labor and not mind having it on in the background .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in other words , one could fold laundry while glancing up at it every now and then , but it's rather boring to just sit and watch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie is surprisingly not as violent as one expects from b-movies in this genre , but it is still an adult r-rated film due to sexual situations and a suicide attempt .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this turkey , ultimately , isn't awful , but it's not particularly interesting or unique either .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: don't be seduced into watching this movie unless you've got several loads of laundry and nothing else to watch .
docs.label: negative
